lines.text: You don't walk out on Sinatra, sir.

[about Ben's Halloween costume dressed as Hitler]
Your father says you're not going out dressed that way.
And I'm not changing.
He says he's not changing.
I wanna talk to Hitler.
He has a swastika on his arm and big black boots! He's wearing big black boots! He came down the stairs in them with swastikas all over!
Put the Führer on the phone!
Your father wants to talk to you. Sorry!

[to his friends]
You guys can go without me. Yeah, I'm having Halloween here.
How are the coloureds doing at school?
Okay, they're doing okay. They're getting better grades than I am. The girl's pretty attractive.
What?
...She's attractive.

[angrily]
Oh, just kill me now! Just kill me now!
What are you talking about...
What do you mean "she's attractive"?
Pretty.
Oh my God...
Mom, I said she was attractive, that doesn't necessarily mean I'm attracted to her!

[voice-over at the end]
Life is made up of a few big moments, and a lot of little ones. I still remember the first time I kissed Sylvia, or the last time I hugged my father before he died. And I still remember that white-bread sandwich and that blonde dancing girl with the cigarette pack on her thigh. But a lot of images fade, and no matter how hard I try, I can't get them back. I had a relative once who said that if I knew things would no longer be, I would have tried to remember better.
Don't make me moody.
The government doesn't know from shit. They integrate the golf courses in '51, and schools in '54. Where's their priorities?
They integrated the cricket field in Clifton Park back in '50. Can't find a colored person who plays cricket.
I beg to differ. That was part of the separate but equal ruling. The coloreds could only play cricket on Tuesdays.
You can't find a colored person who wants to play cricket on Tuesday, Wednesday, or Kiss-My-Tuchis-Day.
For that matter, you can't find a white person who wants to play cricket. What is it with that game? It makes no sense. How many players do you need there? What do they use, a mallet or something?
Isn't that the one with the hoops?
That's croquet.
Nah, croquet is something you eat.
Everything is something you eat.
No, I saw it here on the menu.
[after Trey has crashed his car]
This is very unfortunate.
You know, it's obvious the smiling pumpkins distracted me.
Do you speak french?
No. Do you?
Yes. Not as well as my father's boyfriend. But then again, he is French.
So where are you from?
Forest Park.

[surprised]
Forest Park?
Yeah, off Liberty Heights.
That's, uh, Jewish, right?

[nervous pause]
Damn near, yeah... Seems, uh, more's moving in too, y'know? So it's really... it's really getting that way.
Get a haircut.
By the way, where's the jawbone of the ass?
What?
The jawbone of the ass, where is it?
Is he crazy? What kind of talk is this?

[walks in]
Your ass does not have a jawbone.
Well, Samson slew the Philistines with the jawbone of an ass!
Not your ass, an animal!

[shocked]
There's an animal called an "ass"?

[frowning]
Such a mouth...
Look, I loved 'Samson and Delilah'. I hope they bring that movie back.

[impersonating]
"... and he slew *hundreds* with the jawbone of an ass!"
What, you believe this stuff?
I don't know.
What do you mean you don't know? It's in the Bible!
Oh, so that makes it true?
It's the Bible! A story.
Yeah, a true story?
